questions.text: Use the pumping lemma to prove the following language is not regular: L1 = {w over {a,b,c} | w has twice the number of a's as b's.}

rubric.instructions: Check if student properly used pumping lemma with correct setup, found a valid contradiction, and reached proper conclusion.

questions.text: Prove the language L2 defined below is either regular or not regular. L2 = {w over {a,b} | w has the same number of a's and b's, and |w| <= 2}

rubric.instructions: Check if student correctly determined whether L2 is regular or not and provided proper justification. L2 is finite (only: Îµ, a, b, ab, ba), therefore it is regular.

grading_instructions: Grade fairly and consistently. For each question, determine if the student: (1) did not submit, (2) attempted the question, (3) got most of it right with minor errors, or (4) completely solved it correctly. Award partial credit based on the rubric.
